intro: Silene otites subsp. hungarica, commonly known as the Hungarian catchfly, is a flowering plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and rocky soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers bloom from June to August. Silene otites subsp. hungarica is often found in disturbed habitats and is considered a rare or endangered species in some regions.
